page.description: Return a list of tables for the current database.

prototypes.prototype: Table_List as C = <SQL::Connection>.ListTables( [ IncludeTables as L [, IncludeViews as L [, IncludeSystemTables as L [, IncludeSynonyms as L [, IncludeAliases as L ]]]]] )

section.description: The ListTables() method returns a list of tables for the current database.
section.note: The overload below is still allowed, but is obsolute. Use a TableFilter argument instead.

section.example: C ListTables( [IncludeTables as L [, IncludeViews as L [, IncludeLinkedTables as L [, IncludeSystemTables as L [, IncludeSynonyms as L [, IncludeAliases as L]]]]]])

section.title: Example
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim connString as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" if .not. conn.open(connString) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if ui_msg_box("Tables", conn.ListTables(.T., .T., .T., .T., .T.)) conn.close()
dim Filter as SQL::TableFilter Filter.IncludeViews = .t. Connection.ListTables(Filter)
